author: arxis75
content: Hi. Noob question about transaction signatures: shouldn't the 'v'/'signature_y_parity' parameters take up to 4 different values, to support the case when R.x is > curve_order and < field_order? Thanx

author: arxis75
content:
(curve and field orders refer to the secp256k1 elliptic curve)
(R.x refers to the x coordinate used to calculate r = R.x % curve_order)

author: arxis75
content: With a 4-values parameters, it would save at least one round of keccak256 to verify against the sender address, as the public Key would become deterministic from the signature.

author: sky.cactus
content: I believe `r`/`x` cannot be larger than base point order in Ethereum signatures.

author: sky.cactus
content: If it ends up greater than base point order, you should try again with a new nonce.
